pr_title: [#9940] Instructor module: standardize API endpoints, remove HttpRequestService

timeline.message: Create unpublishFeedbackSession in feedback session service
Add tests for course and questions service

timeline.bodyText: The cron job's URL should not be exposed right?
timeline.author: xpdavid

replies.bodyText: I created the endpoints because I wasn't too sure if we might need it, but since it's unnecessary I will remove it.
replies.author: tiuweehan

replies.bodyText: Both should not be exposed if you take a careful look at what they do.
replies.author: xpdavid

replies.bodyText:
Yup the cron's URLs are used only in the backend so I understand why we don't need it. I'm not too sure about  the legacy URLs, but I suppose since it's legacy we're trying to avoid using them.
I have removed both from my PR. Is there anything else I need to add/change? Otherwise I think this PR is ready. (There are more instructor modules with HttpRequestService, but this PR might become very large if I refactored them too, so I'm planning to do them in another PR)
replies.author: tiuweehan

timeline.bodyText: I don't think this one should be exposed either.
timeline.author: xpdavid

timeline.message: Remove Cron job and Legacy API endpoints

Merge branch 'master' into 9940-standardize-instructor-api-endpoints

* master:
  [#9382] Add MasqueradeModeService Tests (#9955)
  [#9302] Support rich text for MCQ option text (#9944)
  [#9642] Feedback sessions with # or ? in their name can't be edited. (#9925)
  [#9970] Fix failing Travis build (#9971)

timeline.bodyText: Question: Is this a good design? (i.e. let the backend to decide what the frontend URL should be). Looks like it should be other way around. the control of frontend URL should be in the frontend rather than the backend.
timeline.author: xpdavid

replies.bodyText:
Isn't this the current design implementation as well? The URLs are defined in the Const.java file, and are matched by the frontend string literals.
I'm not sure if there are any gradle plugins that can convert TypeScript enums to Java enums, but I'll look into it.
replies.author: tiuweehan

replies.bodyText:
Isn't this the current design implementation as well?

You are syncing this file WebPageEndpoints.java to the frontend right? In what situation will the frontend use this file? You might argue that this file can be used for any redirections in the frontend. But my question is, if one days the redirection changes, you should also modify the file in the backend which is a bit weired.
replies.author: xpdavid

replies.bodyText:
I see what you mean. My intention was to sync both endpoints on the frontend and backend, so I thought it would be best to use a single source of truth in Const.java.
If that's the case, should I just remove WebPageEndpoints.java entirely?
replies.author: tiuweehan

timeline.message: Refactor to not pass model as parameter

timeline.bodyText: ActionURIs is deprecated? Why bother sync it to the frontend?
timeline.author: xpdavid

timeline.message: Move optionals to an object parameter
